channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: One week into post-Assad rule in Syria - a view from Damascus
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Assad's fall came too late for one NPR reporter's father
item.description: Assad's fall came too late for the father of NPR's Diaa Hadid, who was briefly detained by Syrian forces during their occupation of northern Lebanon.
item.content:encoded: Assad's fall came too late for the father of NPR's Diaa Hadid, who was briefly detained by Syrian forces during their occupation of northern Lebanon.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: ABC agrees to give $15 million to Trump's presidential library to settle lawsuit
item.description: ABC News agreed to pay $15 million to Trump's presidential library to settle a lawsuit over George Stephanopoulos' inaccurate on-air assertion that Trump was found liable for raping E. Jean Carroll.
item.content:encoded:
ABC News agreed to pay $15 million to Trump's presidential library to settle a lawsuit over George Stephanopoulos' inaccurate on-air assertion that Trump was found liable for raping E. Jean Carroll.

(Image credit: Stephanie Scarbrough)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Luigi Mangione retains high-profile former prosecutor as defense lawyer
item.description: Karen Friedman Agnifilo was second-in-command at the Manhattan District Attorney's Office. There, she prosecuted violent crime cases, including those that had "a mental health component."
item.content:encoded:
Karen Friedman Agnifilo was second-in-command at the Manhattan District Attorney's Office. There, she prosecuted violent crime cases, including those that had "a mental health component."

(Image credit: Jeff Swensen)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Woman who accuses Jay-Z of raping her at 13 shares new details about alleged assault
item.description: The woman said that during the alleged assault, she tried to resist but Jay-Z told her to stop. She also acknowledged some inconsistencies in her account but firmly maintained that she was attacked.
item.content:encoded:
The woman said that during the alleged assault, she tried to resist but Jay-Z told her to stop. She also acknowledged some inconsistencies in her account but firmly maintained that she was attacked.

(Image credit: Noel Vasquez)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Pearl Harbor survivor dies at 100
item.description: Bob Fernandez was a 17-year-old sailor on board the USS Curtiss during the Dec. 7, 1941, attack that propelled the U.S. into World War II.
item.content:encoded:
Bob Fernandez was a 17-year-old sailor on board the USS Curtiss during the Dec. 7, 1941, attack that propelled the U.S. into World War II.

(Image credit: Godofredo A. Vásquez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'Wait Wait' for December 14, 2024: Live at Carnegie Hall with Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson
item.description: This week, Wait Wait is live at Carnegie Hall with special guest Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson and panelists Paula Poundstone, Joyelle Nicole Johnson, and Mo Rocca
item.content:encoded:
This week, Wait Wait is live at Carnegie Hall with special guest Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson and panelists Paula Poundstone, Joyelle Nicole Johnson, and Mo Rocca

(Image credit: Paul Morigi)

item.title: Opinion: Airbnb will recreate gladiator drama in the Colosseum
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon details the "gladiator experience" that 16 lucky — or unlucky — people might have next year inside the Roman Colosseum. Will they not be entertained?
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Scott Simon details the "gladiator experience" that 16 lucky — or unlucky — people might have next year inside the Roman Colosseum. Will they not be entertained?

(Image credit: Gregorio Borgia)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: South Korea's parliament votes to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol
item.description: South Korea's parliament impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol for his attempt to impose martial law, the first time such a measure had been imposed on the nation in more than four decades.
item.content:encoded:
South Korea's parliament impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol for his attempt to impose martial law, the first time such a measure had been imposed on the nation in more than four decades.

(Image credit: Anthony Wallace)
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Will the FDA finally ban Red No. 3? A decision could come soon
item.description: The food colorant has been linked to behavioral problems in children, including inattention and hyperactivity. California passed a law to ban it last year.
item.content:encoded:
The food colorant has been linked to behavioral problems in children, including inattention and hyperactivity. California passed a law to ban it last year.

(Image credit: mtreasure)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey
